Recent versions tidywikidatar include dedicated function get details, tw_get_property_with_details(), currently cache results. tidywikidatar useful particular exploratory analysis relatively small numbers wikidata items (dozens hundreds), becomes quickly less efficient asking many properties thousands items. Functions take time, eventually complete. performance improvements may come future versions tidywikidatar, larger batches data (large number items/many properties), well formed queries remain efficient.

title: Explore Wikidata Through Tidy Data Frames

code: tw_check_cache_index(   table_name = NULL,   type = "item",   show_details = FALSE,   language = tidywikidatar::tw_get_language(),   response_language = tidywikidatar::tw_get_language(),   cache = NULL,   cache_connection = NULL,   disconnect_db = TRUE )

title: Check if cache table is indexed — tw_check_cache_index
text: table_name Name table database. given, takes precedence parameters. type Defaults "item". Type cache file output. Values typically used tidywikidatar include "item", "search_item", "search_property", "qualifier". show_details Logical, defaults FALSE. FALSE, return logical vector length one (TRUE table indexed, FALSE ). TRUE, returns data frame details index. language Defaults language set tw_set_language(); "en" set. Used limit data cached. Use "all_available" keep data. available values, see https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Help:Wikimedia_language_codes/lists/response_language Defaults language set tw_set_language(); "en" set. Relevant type set "search_item" "search_property". See tw_search() details. cache Defaults NULL. given, given either TRUE FALSE. Typically set tw_enable_cache() tw_disable_cache(). cache_connection Defaults NULL. NULL, caching enabled, tidywikidatar use local sqlite database. custom connection databases can given (see vignette caching details). disconnect_db Defaults TRUE. FALSE, leaves connection cache open.

title: Check if cache table is indexed — tw_check_cache_index

TRUE, search returned additional column. wait seconds, defaults 0. Time wait queries Wikidata. data cached locally, wait time applied. running many queries systematically may want add waiting time queries. cache Defaults NULL. given, given either TRUE FALSE. Typically set tw_enable_cache() tw_disable_cache(). overwrite_cache Defaults FALSE. TRUE, overwrites cache. cache_connection Defaults NULL. code: # By default, it returns a list of the same length as input, # no matter how many values for each id/property   if (interactive()) {   tw_get_property_same_length(     id = c(       "Q180099",       "Q228822",       "Q76857"     ),     p = "P26"   )   # Notice that if no relevant match is found, it returns a NA   # This is useful for piped operations    tibble::tibble(id = c(     "Q180099",     "Q228822",     "Q76857"   )) %>%     dplyr::mutate(spouse = tw_get_property_same_length(id, "P26"))    # Consider unnesting for further analysis    tibble::tibble(id = c(     "Q180099",     "Q228822",     "Q76857"   )) %>%     dplyr::mutate(spouse = tw_get_property_same_length(id, "P26")) %>%     tidyr::unnest(cols = spouse)    # If you are sure that you are interested only in the first return value,   # consider setting only_first=TRUE to get a character vector rather than a list   # Be mindful: you may well be discarding valid values.   tibble::tibble(id = c(     "Q180099",     "Q228822",     "Q76857"   )) %>%     dplyr::mutate(spouse = tw_get_property_same_length(id, "P26",       only_first = TRUE     )) } tw_get_p(id = "Q180099", "P26") #> [[1]] #> [1] "Q314252"  "Q594736"  "Q2144944" #>

title: Add index to caching table for search queries for increased speed — tw_index_cache_item
text: table_name Name table database. given, takes precedence parameters. check_first Logical, defaults TRUE. Values typically used tidywikidatar include "item", "search_item", "search_property", "qualifier". show_details Logical, defaults FALSE. FALSE, return function adds index database, return anything. TRUE, returns data frame details index. language Defaults language set tw_set_language(); "en" set. Used limit data cached. Use "all_available" keep data. available values, see https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Help:Wikimedia_language_codes/lists/cache Defaults NULL. given, given either TRUE FALSE. Typically set tw_enable_cache() tw_disable_cache(). cache_connection Defaults NULL. FALSE, leaves connection cache open.

title: Reset Wikipedia page link cache — tw_reset_wikipedia_page_sections_cache
text: language Defaults language set tw_set_language(); set, "en". Use "all_available" keep languages. available language values, see https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Help:Wikimedia_language_codes/lists/cache Defaults NULL. given, given either TRUE FALSE. Typically set tw_enable_cache() tw_disable_cache(). cache_connection Defaults NULL. NULL, caching enabled, tidywikidatar use local sqlite database default. custom connection databases can given (see vignette caching details). disconnect_db Defaults TRUE. FALSE, leaves connection cache open. ask Logical, defaults TRUE. FALSE, cache folder exist, just creates without asking (useful non-interactive sessions).

text: Nothing, used side effects.

title: Search for Wikidata items or properties and return Wikidata id, label, and description. — tw_search
text: search string searched Wikidata type Defaults "item". Either "item" "property". language Language used search. Can set per session tw_set_language(). set, defaults "en". full list, see https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Help:Wikimedia_language_codes/lists/response_language Language used returned labels descriptions. Corresponds uselang parameter MediaWiki API: https://www.wikidata.org/w/api.php?action=help&modules=wbsearchentities. Can set per session tw_set_language(). set, defaults "en". full list, see https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Help:Wikimedia_language_codes/lists/limit Maximum numbers responses given. include_search Logical, defaults FALSE. TRUE, search returned additional column. wait seconds, defaults 0. Time wait queries Wikidata. data cached locally, wait time applied. running many queries systematically may want add waiting time queries. cache Defaults NULL. given, given either TRUE FALSE. Typically set tw_enable_cache() tw_disable_cache(). overwrite_cache Defaults FALSE. TRUE, overwrites cache. cache_connection Defaults NULL. NULL, caching enabled, tidywikidatar use local sqlite database. custom connection databases can given (see vignette caching details). disconnect_db Defaults TRUE. FALSE, leaves connection cache open.

title: Search for Wikidata items or properties and return Wikidata id, label, and description. — tw_search
text: data frame (tibble) three columns (id, label, description), many rows results (default, limited 10). Four columns include_search set TRUE.

what: Set database connection settings for the session — tw_set_cache_db
title: Set database connection settings for the session — tw_set_cache_db
text: Set database connection settings session

title: Set database connection settings for the session — tw_set_cache_db
code: tw_set_cache_db(   db_settings = NULL,   driver = NULL,   host = NULL,   server = NULL,   port = NULL,   database = NULL,   user = NULL,   pwd = NULL )

title: Set database connection settings for the session — tw_set_cache_db
text: db_settings list database connection settings (see example) driver database driver. Common database drivers include MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB. See unique(odbc::odbcListDrivers()[[1]]) list locally available drivers. host Host address, e.g. "localhost". Different drivers use server host parameter, one likely needed. server Server address, e.g. "localhost". Different drivers use server host parameter, one likely needed. port Port use connect database. database Database name. user Database user name. pwd Password database user.

title: Set database connection settings for the session — tw_set_cache_db
text: list given parameters (invisibly).

title: Set database connection settings for the session — tw_set_cache_db
code: # \donttest{ if (interactive()) {    # Settings can be provided either as a list   db_settings <- list(     driver = "MySQL",     host = "localhost",     server = "localhost",     port = 3306,     database = "tidywikidatar",     user = "secret_username",     pwd = "secret_password"   )    tw_set_cache_db(db_settings)    # or as parameters    tw_set_cache_db(     driver = "MySQL",     host = "localhost",     server = "localhost",     port = 3306,     database = "tidywikidatar",     user = "secret_username",     pwd = "secret_password"   )    # or ignoring fields that can be left to default values, such as "localhost" and port 3306    tw_set_cache_db(     driver = "MySQL",     database = "tidywikidatar",     user = "secret_username",     pwd = "secret_password"   ) } # }

title: Writes item to cache — tw_write_item_to_cache
text: item_df data frame three columns typically generated tw_get(). language Defaults language set tw_set_language(); set, "en". Use "all_available" keep languages. available language values, see https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Help:Wikimedia_language_codes/lists/cache Defaults NULL. given, given either TRUE FALSE. Typically set tw_enable_cache() tw_disable_cache(). overwrite_cache Logical, defaults FALSE. TRUE, first deletes rows associated item(s) included item_df. Useful original Wikidata object updated. cache_connection Defaults NULL. NULL, caching enabled, tidywikidatar use local sqlite database. custom connection databases can given (see vignette caching details). disconnect_db Defaults TRUE. FALSE, leaves connection cache open.

title: Writes item to cache — tw_write_item_to_cache
text: Nothing, used side effects.

title: Writes item to cache — tw_write_item_to_cache
code: tw_set_cache_folder(path = fs::path(tempdir(), paste(sample(letters, 24), collapse = ""))) tw_create_cache_folder(ask = FALSE) tw_disable_cache()  df_from_api <- tw_get(id = "Q180099", language = "en")  df_from_cache <- tw_get_cached_item(   id = "Q180099",   language = "en" )  is.null(df_from_cache) # expect TRUE, as nothing has yet been stored in cache #> [1] FALSE  tw_write_item_to_cache(   item_df = df_from_api,   language = "en",   cache = TRUE )  df_from_cache <- tw_get_cached_item(   id = "Q180099",   language = "en",   cache = TRUE )  is.null(df_from_cache) # expect a data frame, same as df_from_api #> [1] FALSE

title: Write Wikipedia page links to cache — tw_write_wikipedia_page_sections_to_cache
text: df data frame typically generated tw_get_wikipedia_page_sections(). language Defaults language set tw_set_language(); set, "en". Use "all_available" keep languages. available language values, see https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Help:Wikimedia_language_codes/lists/cache Defaults NULL. given, given either TRUE FALSE. Typically set tw_enable_cache() tw_disable_cache(). overwrite_cache Logical, defaults FALSE. TRUE, overwrites table local sqlite database. Useful original Wikidata object updated. cache_connection Defaults NULL. NULL, caching enabled, tidywikidatar use local sqlite database. custom connection databases can given (see vignette caching details). disconnect_db Defaults TRUE. FALSE, leaves connection cache open.

title: tidywikidatar 0.5.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-01-26 new vignette examples starting Wikipedia page, examples using piped operations, clearer references separate group functions official documentation website tw_get() now keeps rank default, facilitating retrieving relevant results tw_get_qualifiers() now includes ranking “preferred”, “normal”, “deprecated” associated property, well value type output (new format incompatible previous cache, reset cache tw_reset_qualifiers_cache()) tw_get_qualifiers() returns correctly value qualifier value type string (Wikidata identifier, date) tw_get_image() respects parameters consistently. tw_get_image() tw_get_image_metadata() now briefly described README. tw_get_wikipedia_page_links() now caches results, provides consistent results data frame introduce tw_get_p() alias tw_get_property_same_length() brevity introduce new parameters tw_get_p() deal common pattern “preferred” recent property returned, rather whatever Wikidata first list, add new section readme add example datasets illustrative purposes forthcoming additional vignettes examples, tw_qid_meps tw_qid_airports drop legacy include_id_and_p parameter tw_get_qualifiers() add support setting database connection parameters tw_set_cache_db() easier use alternatives SQLite new naming convention local SQLite database, reflect change now one database per language improve handling connections reduce risk connections remaining open, aiming higher efficiency integration shiny apps bug fix: fix error Wikidata item label language

title: tidywikidatar 0.5.1
text: CRAN release: 2022-03-11 introduce functions get list sections Wikipedia pages - tw_get_wikipedia_page_sections() - extract links specific section - tw_get_wikipedia_page_section_links() introduce convenience function get Wikidata items given property, irrespective value, tw_get_all_with_p() tw_search() now separate parameters search language, language label description returned (previously, always English) fix tw_get_qualifiers() qualifier value type quantity keep smooth caching also Wikidata item values label current language introduce additional settings database connections drivers need minor bug fixes

title: tidywikidatar 0.5.2
text: CRAN release: 2022-05-18 new feature: tw_get_p_wide() offers efficient way get wide data frames number properties (relative labels) set Wikidata id; also facilitates collapsing values ease export csv. new: introduce tw_get_p1() shorthand tw_get_p(only_first = TRUE, preferred = TRUE) new: pre-cached data given functions tw_get_property() tw_get_label(), looks missing data present given data frame new: introduce cache indexing convenience functions, tw_index_cache_item() tw_index_cache_search(). significantly improved performance caching backend, currently introduced opt-thoroughly tested different database drivers. Running drastically improve performance MySql cache goes million items. See also vignette caching. fix: don’t look cache folder cache disabled tw_get_p() fix: better handling cases NA (including, vector NA), NULL, given input various functions fix: partial pre-cached data frame passed tw_get() functions input, missing items queried fix: tw_get_wikipedia() consistently returns vector length input fix: rank column mistakenly dropped cases using tw_get_property() fix: caching language set manually via parameter (instead via environment variable), separate SQLite database used, expected new: tw_check_qid() parameters deal different use cases new: new set functions add index databases improve performance local cache grows many millions rows (tw_check_cache_index(), tw_index_cache_item(), tw_index_cache_search()). Tested MySql. _single functions used internally now exported facilitate auto-complete new maintainer email address due CRAN issues
